workflow.name: Publish LinkedIn & X posts with Telegram Bot, Gemini AI & Vector Memory
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

# Overview

This is a Telegram Bot capable of receiving information from the user in the form of text messages, voice messages, images or documents (e.g., presentations, PDFs, HTML pages), and publishing posts to the user's social platforms.

The bot always sends the user a draft of the post for verification before publishing it.

The bot saves relevant information to its long-term memory (vector store), so you don't need to repeat it in every interaction (e.g., who you are, your company, product, etc.).

This template supports creating posts in LinkedIn and X.

# Setup

## Requirements
To use this template your will need:
1. Google's AI Studio API key. Get one here: https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey
2. Telegram Bot API key. You receive one when you register a new Telegram Bot via @BotFather bot in Telegram.
3. LinkedIn API key. Follow the instructions here to create one: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/linkedin/
4. X API key. Follow the instructions here to create one: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/twitter/

## Step-by-step instruction
1. Import this template
2. Create a new Telegram Bot or get an API key for existing one.
3. Configre Telegram nodes with Telegram API key.
4. Obtain a Google's AI Studio API key. Set it in "Describe document", "Describe audio" and "Google Gemini Chat Model".
5. Create an API key for LinkedIn.
6. Create an API key for X.
7. Set our LinkedIn key in "Create post in LinkedIn" nodes.
8. Set your X key in "Create X (Twitter) post" node.

## Other
Bright-colored notes in the template highlight information that needs to be set before launching the template.

assignments.name: update_type
chatInput

options.systemMessage:
Act as a content manager specializing in social media management, public relations, and network management. Your role involves several key responsibilities when a user requests to create a social media post.
Your output should be not use Markdown, HTML or anything else. Your responses will be passed as text messages to the user.

- **Understand User Input**: First, clearly understand the user's request regarding the content they wish to post on their social networks. Gather necessary details and context from the user to ensure the post is accurate and aligned with their goals.

- **Context Collection**: If additional context is needed, and not provided, ask the user specific and targeted questions to obtain any missing information. Use the "get_context_records" tool to fetch existing records and the "save_context_record" tool to store any new information.

- **Post Creation**: Use the provided information to create a draft social media post. This includes formulating engaging and relevant content tailored to the user's specified platform and audience.

- **User Approval Process**: Present the draft to the user for feedback and approval. Never post anything without explicit user's approval!

- **Posting**: After receiving approval from the user, post the content using the corresponding social media tools.

parameters.toolDescription: Create Tweet in X. Text must be 280 characters or less. If you receive "Forbidden" error, it means that the text is too long, you need to shorted it.

parameters.content:
## Bot entrance

Set your Telegram bot credentials here.

Optional: add "Restrict to chat IDs" with your chat ID so that only you can use your bot

## Request preprocessing

Setting fields from the request to a more convinient format

## Extracting data from non-text input

Set up "Describe PDF" and "Describe audio" nodes with Google's AI Studio API key

Set up "Download document" and "Download audio" with Telegram Bot API key

## AI Agent Node

**Needs setup**

Add your Google's AI Studio API key to the "Model" node

Here the agent receives the user's input and decides what to do it response:
- Ask for clarification
- Prepare the post and send for verification
- Create a post in LinkedIn or X
- Save some information in long-term memory

## Response to the user
Here we optionally split the agent's response into multiple messages not to get "Message too long" error from Telegram

## LinkedIn Tools

- Input your organisation URN in the "Create post in LinkedIn as a company" node
- Select your user name in LinkedIn in the "Create a post in LinkedIn as a person"

nodes.name: Create post in LinkedIn as a company

parameters.toolDescription: Create a post in LinkedIn as a company

nodes.name: Create post in LinkedIn as a person

parameters.toolDescription: Create a post in LinkedIn as a person

parameters.content:
## Your personal AI SMM manager inside Telegram bot 

This is a Telegram Bot capable of receiving info from the user in the format of text messages, voice messages or documents (i.e. presentations) and publishing posts to the user's social platforms.

### Bot's behavior
- Bot always sends user a draft of the post for verification before publishing it
- Bot saves relevant information to it's long-term memory (vector store) so that you don't need to repeat it in every interaction (i.e. who are you, your company, product, etc.)

### How it works
Every non-text messages gets encoded in base64 and passed to Gemini API to extract information for it.
AI Agent gets user's input and takes neccessary actions: saves relevant information to long-term memory, prepared posts or creates posts in social networks.
Agent's response is passed to the user as bot's response. 

### Requirements
To use this template your will need:
1. Google's AI Studio API key. Get one here: https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey
2. Telegram Bot API key. You receive one when you register a new Telegram Bot via @BotFather bot in Telegram.
3. LinkedIn API key. Follow the instructions here to create one: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/linkedin/
4. X API key. Follow the instructions here to create one: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/twitter/

### Step-by-step instruction
1. Import this template
2. Create a new Telegram Bot or get an API key for existing one.
3. Configre Telegram nodes with Telegram API key.
4. Obtain a Google's AI Studio API key. Set it in "Describe document", "Describe audio" and "Google Gemini Chat Model".
5. Create an API key for LinkedIn.
6. Create an API key for X.
7. Set our LinkedIn key in "Create post in LinkedIn" nodes.
8. Set your X key in "Create X (Twitter) post" node.
**Notes of this color describe information that need's to be set before launching the template - please take a look!**

parameters.description: Call this tool to save some knowledge received from the user. Pass what you want to save in "data" parameter.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
